intro: Potentilla rehderiana, commonly known as Rehder's cinquefoil, is a perennial shrub native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the Rosaceae family and is characterized by its small, yellowish flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm and has finely divided, fern-like leaves that are alternate along the stems. It thrives in well-drained soils and full sun, often found in alpine and subalpine environments. Due to its ornamental value and ecological significance, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens and conservation areas.
